lines.text: Father was known as the "King of Chemical Fertilizer." It sounds awful but it's really wonderful stuff. I'll send you some. It's good on everything. Anyhow, I guess that makes me the "Crown Prince of Fertilizer."
You know something?
What?
You're spoiled... but you're sweet.
That's what my mother used to say when she kissed me goodnight.
I'm a nurse.
Good heavens, not really?
Yes, is that bad?
Bad? The history of the medical profession is unparalleled in the annals of crime, if you don't mind my saying so.

[politely annoyed]
I'm afraid I do mind.
Well, that's absurd. The so-called science of medicine is one part theft, one part hocus pocus and the rest a form of legalized murder.
What's so funny?

[Slightly tipsy]
The overgrown ice cube. He thinks I'm unethical 'cause I take a fancy to someone who's clever, good-looking and rich in sin. Am I unethical?
You're loaded!
A pleasant glow. Just enough to cast a beam of light down the pathway of the future.
Forget it, forget it! It's only money. Don't tell that to my lawyer.

[Introducing her almost fiancé to her almost ex-husband]
Oh, this is, ah, Malcolm.
[to Malcolm]
Say, "How do you do."

[obediently, extending his hand]
How do you do.
Hello, Malcolm.
Isn't he a doll? He owns a whole chain of drugstores.
I hope you've got lost of aspirin, man.

[to her about-to-be ex-husband]
I didn't want to go into court thinking there were any hard feelings. After all, we've had our little difficulties but... that's all in the past. I want you to know, I forgive you.
I'm touched... for 300 grand to be exact.

[to her estranged husband]
Oh, I forgot. Mother sends her love.
Collect, no doubt.
You know a woman's best weapon is to leave a man unsatisfied.
Really?
Mm hmm.
What is man's best weapon?
Money.
As a lawyer, I always advise against doing anything unethical... unless you can get away with it.

[to his attorney]
How about what she did to me? She thinks a marriage license is a one-way ticket to the vault.
